poem:
**Thresholds**  

The air holds quiet conversations,  
debating the weight of breath.  
Behind closed doors, laws sketched  
like pencil marks on margins.  
We stand at thresholds, half-shadowed,  
considering the dignity of silence.  
Politicians speak in careful murmurs;  
the fingers of fate trace ancient paths  
across uncharted terrain, seeking  
resolution in the margins of life.
